results.title: The Mallaganee boy
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: David Ferrier is a young farmer operating the family farm 25 km outside Birchip. In this short interview he talks about his relationship with the farm and the land and his unusual hobby of whip cracking.

results.title: Bobby and the Birchip Leisure Centre
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: The Birchip Leisure Centre is the social hub of Birchip township and surrounds. In addition to providing clubrooms for the local football, hockey, netball, golf and tennis clubs, the leisure centre also plays host to social events and functions. What is key to the centre is the fact that it is community built and funded - everyone in the local area collaborated to raise money and build the facilities. Here the manager, Bobby Liston, gives a personal view of this important place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development

results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development

results.title: Birchip Historical Society
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Containing a treasure trove of artefacts and memories, the Birchip Historical Society museum is maintained and staffed by hardworking volunteers from the area. Here Dorothy Reid, Harry Rickard and Ken Kemp talk about some memorable objects and the importance of the Historical Society to the community’s wellbeing.

results.title: The Birchip boy who became a legend
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: An intimate portrait of 84-year-old Roger Hogan, aka Australian Country music legend ‘Dusty Rankin’. Born and raised in Birchip, Dusty appeared on Australia’s Amateur Hour in 1946 and maintained an active career through to 1961 when he returned to working the farm full-time. He was one of the most popular country artists of the time, with many of his songs becoming popular standards. Here Roger remembers his rich life of touring but ultimately brings it all back home.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development

results.title: The Birchip Cropping Group
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: A background history of the Birchip Cropping Group, an agricultural research and extension organisation covering the Wimmera Mallee region set up to assist farmers in crop production. Its philosophy is to produce food that is clean, safe and green. Presented by Alexandra, Fiona, James, Simon and the BCG.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Attilio
results.creator_credit: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
results.brief_description:
Oe of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Attilio, a retired fitter and turner, is part of a powerful Italian tradition of high quality artisanship. He still works at home, doing small, specialised jobs. His basic galvanised iron shed is lined with tools of the trade - boxes and shelves filled with mostly metallic bits and pieces that get pieced together with absolute passion and craft. Attilio is also an entertainer - a funny guy and the life of the party. He has produced many CDs of his songs and is regularly booked for events by the South Australian Italian community. Attilio’s taverna is an open-sided room with a big table and a gas stove at one end - complete with an espresso machine for making short blacks (sometimes with a dash of the grappa!). In his taverna Attilio spends time with his brother Joe and his friends, enjoying Italian food and the fruits of his other labour – wine making. So Attilio’s backyard has two sheds – one for sharing friendship and entertainment, the other for the serious work. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Des
results.creator_credit: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Des lives and works on his farming property in the historical German region of The Barossa Valley in South Australia. He has a hint of a German accent – all the more surprising since he is the third generation of his family born in Australia. There are many sheds on the property housing equipment that belonged to his father and grandfather before him. In a beautifully well-preserved hay thatched shed, a vast collection can be viewed as an almost historical “museum” to early farming technology. Des knows where everything is - although some of it has probably not been used for 20 or 30 years. But the equipment is still in working condition and we witness Des using a combination of that equipment as part of his working day. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Country is my life
results.creator_credit: John Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Johnnie Lovett endeavours to express his love for country music, how it feeds his spirit and the people who have inspired and encouraged him to become a musician in the first place.
